headline: Sarah's Homemade Applesauce
description: This applesauce recipe is easy to make from scratch with apples, sugar, and cinnamon for a delicious topping on pancakes, ice cream, or pork chops.

video.description: Try this crowd-pleasing recipe for homemade applesauce.
video.name: Sarah's Applesauce

name: Sarah's Homemade Applesauce

recipeInstructions.text: Combine apples, water, sugar, and cinnamon in a saucepan; cover and cook over medium heat until apples are soft, about 15 to 20 minutes.
Allow apple mixture to cool, then mash with a fork or potato masher until it is the consistency you like.

review.reviewBody: Very easy to make. I used 6 Gala apples and didn't add any sugar and it came out great! Will definitely make it again.

Wow was this good! I followed recipe. I used Granny Smith apples which worked really well. Served slightly warm and was really and amazing! Hadn‚Äôt made homemade applesauce before, but definitely will again!

I purchased a bag of small apples that weren't very good -- lacked flavor as an 'eatin apple'. I was going to throw the apples out then saw this recipe. I thought what the heck, I was going to throw them out anyway. I made exactly as recipe called for using 8 of the small apples as they would suffice for 4 regular sized. It turned out DELICIOUS. Easy and I didn't waste those apples. For some reason applesauce has really increased in price -- so glad I used those apples up for applesauce. This is a WINNER!
Easy to make and pretty tasty! Using my food processor to mash the apples made it super easy! Next time, I'll cut down on amount of sugar added, that was a bit too much.
Yummy!!! My whole family loves it!

I've been making this recipe for about 10 years now. It is the only recipe I will use. I buy a bag of Granny Smith Apples, peel them, chop them, and cook them as directed. I do add more cinnamon in the recipe because I love cinnamon. I freeze it in serving-size portions. Excellent recipe.
Love it

It couldn't be much easier & came out awesome - I'm actually gonna make another batch, I ate it all & my family didn‚Äôt get any. The first batch I used "Granny Smith" - this 2nd round I'm trying "Gala" !!
It is perfect as it is!! I've made it more than once!! I cooks down perfectly. I give it to anyone who will try it and they LOVE it!!
So good üòä ty
Love it and simple process. Thank you. I will rate this for 5 stars!

Easy and delicious. I cut back the mount of sugar just because I like it that way, I am sure this can vary based on personal taste. The water was estimated because I had 2 giant apples and 6 regular so not sure what that equates to. This creates a great smell in the kitchen, and a wonderful homemade side dish.
That was the most easy was of making applesauce, my wife love'd it so much I made five pints of it... Thank you for sharing this....
This worked great! Very simple with a great flavor. I used tart and firm cooking apples, so the sugar was needed. Family loved it and this is a great addition to the family recipes. Thank you so much
Good recipe but would like a review with different types of apples
Have made this several times now with a variety of apples. Outstanding and freezes well!

I make this apple sauce all the time. Quick and easy and delicious. NO longer buy in the store. This is the way to go. Sometimes I add a little brown sugar and cut down on the white. I also use more cinnamon.
Simple is often the best! I used McIntosh apples but didn't peel them. It gave the applesauce more texture, color, and nutrition.
Really great love homemade stuff better than store bought applesauce
So easy and so good. We served it alongside pork roast and both were happily gobbled up.

This is my exact recipe! It‚Äôs so good! I always at least double this. We have an apple tree; sometimes I make a huge amount. The only change I‚Äôve made in over 20 plus years of making this is I use half sugar and half light brown sugar, but keep the total amount of sugar called for the same. Follow this recipe by PHATCAT, you will not be disappointed!
Easy to make. And the taste is amazing. I will be making this again for the family and family get togethers ‚ù§Ô∏è. Thank you for sharing this recipe.

This was great! I had to make two batches in one week because it was so good. We just snacked on it continually until it was gone. I know that some people just can't handle their sugar but, this was the perfect sweetness for me. A few days ago, I used four medium/small apples to make the sauce. It turned out beautiful. Today, I happened to have some very large and fresh Gala apples. Two large apples was enough.
Thanks for the recipe.I made it for myself and my grandkids. They love chunky applesauce. I used mixed apples and left out the sugar. It was a hit.
Very good basic recipe. I used apple cider and 2 tbsp. brandy. Very good.
Simple. I decreased the sugar a lot because I am diabetic. Some apples don't really need a lot of sugar

This is a basic recipe, which is what I was looking for, but it doesn‚Äôt mention the size of the apples (small/medium/large). Listing what kind of apples would be helpful too. Instead of using sugar water, apple juice or cider would be a great improvement. Maybe with maple syrup, lemon juice, or nutmeg as options too. The biggest issue with this recipe is that it doesn‚Äôt specify the size of the apples though
I like my applesauce chunky, so I didn't over mashed it. This recipe makes a very tasty and sweet applesauce.
Best applesauce I‚Äôve ever had and made! I usually use Harrelson apples.

It was so good I couldn't make it into applesauce. We had the apple pieces and I cannot wait to make it into apple pie filling. Followed recipe 100%! This should be apple pie filling. So we cored with the apple corer that cuts into pieces. Then halved those. It was such a hit!!!!!! Best recipe ever!! BTW. Gluten and corn free!! We are celiac and severe corn allergy. That turned us on so much!
So easy, so good!!!
Excellent basic recipe. I use turbinado sugar and add a pinch each of salt and ground clove. Fuji apples are my go-to but the recipe works just as well with Granny Smiths. Definitely recommended!
I have used this recipe several times. I am far from a good cook, but I am so proud of myself every time I make Sarah's applesauce. It is delicious!

Wonderfully easy base recipe. Most all cooks like to make a few changes to any recipe, and this is another that is easy to adapt to your own taste. I love my applesauce chunky, and add just a small amt of nutmeg and lemon juice. It is really all in the taste buds and how youate when growing up!
Thank you for posting this. It is good as you printed it and good with some changes, a very easy dish to make your own. That‚Äôs why it‚Äôs so good!
I should have read the reviews first. Way, way, way too sweet. I had to add the juice of a lemon to even it out, and my husband doesn't like chunky so I used a food processor. He loved it.
This is a great recipe. I omitted the sugar The applesauce was delicious. Thank you for this recipe. I will be making applesauce regularly.
I use a liltte less sugar and agree that a little less water can also be used but overall a great recipe.
For my first time I really don‚Äôt think it came out bad, without measuring as I just gone with the flow, perfect if I have to say so myself, so easy. Thank you so much for the recipe

I didn't make any changes, I cooked and cooled it as directed, and it turned out just like homemade applesauce from my childhood. I will make this over and over and over again. Actually going to add it to my holiday recipe list that I make on holidays.
Good tasty easy recipe.

Simple, tasty, will make again! I wouldn't change anything, the water and sugar were perfect. If you let cool before mashing like the instructions say most of the water gets reabsorbed. I put it warm on vanilla ice cream! Amazing!
Too much water and too sweet. I would cut down on both and add sugar or maple syrup if needed
Great recipe in its' simplicity. My go to for predictable results!
I made it just as it said. Pretty good

I really like this recipe. It‚Äôs a great base to start off with. With that said, I experimented with my own version based of this one. So obviously, there are a few thing that I have changed up. First, I use at least two different kinds of apples. As Fujis are my favorite, I always use those and then whatever else I have lying around. Most often it‚Äôs the apples you get at Panera because I don‚Äôt really like them, but they are great mixed in with other apples. Additionally, I do not add sugar. For my pallet the Fujis are sweet enough. I also add a small smidgeon of sea salt and finally, I squeeze in one lime or lemon wedge, either is fine; I just like to add a bit of acidity. Get creative!

Perfect recipe EXCEPT USE THIS RECIPE FOR EVERY 5 APPLES! watch the Sugar & Water! I added less than half a cup of sugar. Use about (1/3) cup of sugar instead & water I used a 1/3 cup of water. A pinch of cinnamon. Bring to a boil then simmer for 13 minutes. Cool. Put in a blender or processor or use a fork to mash the mixture. Put in a bowl let chill in 4 hours or overnight

This was my first time making applesauce and it went great! I made it to use in applesauce bread and it worked a charm. It's easy to customize too- I added cloves, nutmeg, and some extra cinnamon and cut the sugar. This is an excellent base recipe that you can use to start off likely any kind of applesauce.

I love this recipe! I used granny smith apples and the sugar amount was perfect(I used splenda). I also used the listed amount of water and just tossed in some cinnamon. My lid was not tight fitting. I didn't even watch it. Came back 18 minutes and it was perfect!
Delicious!
It was like eating apple pie without the crust. Delicious
So easy n delicious. Just finished making it. Kitchen smells delicious
Super easy! Instead of using a fork to mash, I threw it in the blender!
I made this applesauce using Fuji apples using 9 apples with the listed amount of sugar ,water and cinnamon to taste . It was Fab-U-Lous . I‚Äôll never look at apples the same again!
SO GOOD BROTHRE LIKED IT AND ME TOO
The thing I did was double the size and it was delicious.
Very easy and quick! Definitely recommend! Only thing is I feel there is something missing I just don‚Äôt know what!

Loved it but I did tweak a little. I added a bit more sugar and did a half and half of white and light brown. After it cooled I used our ninja blender to blend instead of mashing because even after 20 mins I was having a difficult time getting a good texture. The blender made it REALLY smooth so of you like it chunky you're better of mashing. For us, the smooth apple sauce was amazing. Everyone loved it (two picky teen Girls included) and we've made it to add to pork chops or just to have as a snack.. Great recipe!

I leave the skin on to add fiber to the recipe and add a little extra cinnamon. Additionally, I use Splenda instead of regular sugar and it's perfect. My 2 year old niece loves this applesauce. When guests come over and it's served, they ask what brand and surprised it's homemade. Will definitely be making this again.
All ways good. have made this before, sometimes i use white sugar sometimes with brown sugar

I made this and it was very simple and delicious. This time I'm using 2 apples and 2 pears, just to try something different. But it needs nothing to make it better that what Sarah has given. Thank you

Excellent!!! Did NOT have to make any adjustments it feeds 4 people comfortably. I used Granny Smith apples. I highly recommend it‚Äôs going to be made in my home often. Plus my home smelled soooo good while it was cooking

I never follow recipes and/or measurement requirements . Only ingredients. For those complaining about the recipe calling for too much water. Play it by ear. Never mind the measurements and just use good ol‚Äô common sense. Start with less add more as you go.
It‚Äôs applesauce not rocket science.
This is perfect. We buy a case of Fuji apples every year and this applesauce is definitely a hit.
I absolutely love this recipe. Best apple sauce I have ever had.
Delicious! Made my whole house smell like apple pie. Easy recipe too
Excellent. I played with the recipe ‚Äì I threw some blueberries and pears in with the apples and it turned out great. Peaches also worked great.

This applesauce is GREAT! I used more apples, about 8, as I have A TON to use. I used about 3/4c water, 6tbsp of sugar substitute (Swerve), and just sprinkled cinnamon as to not overdo it. I simmered for about 30min and I didn't need to mash a thing- all I did was stir and the apples mushed themselves all up. It's gotten raving reviews so far and I plan to make another batch tomorrow as well. This is my new go-to applesauce recipe. Do yourself a favor and make it!
It was easy and came out great!
This is my go to recipe, I had an extra 6 apples so I made it with a little extra ingredients, it turned out perfect as always! Thank you

This is a great basic applesauce recipe that you can easily jazz up with whatever spices you have on hand. I add a little freshly grated ginger and it's exquisite... sometimes I'll add powdered cloves and/or nutmeg. Yum!
Super easy. But substituted water with Apple cider because why not.

used slice of lemon and water in bucket while peeling apples to keep fresh and keep from turning color. i used less water than this recipe (too runny for me)... added just bit of brown sugar.overall great...

I bought apples at a local orchard to make apple butter and had several apples left over. I decided to make applesauce with them and found this recipe. It is easy quick and delicious. I definitely recommend it.

This was so easy to make and boy was I surprised in how delicious it was as well, tasted like all I needed was ice cream because it seemed to belong in a pie! I used 3 different apples. Gala, Fuji, (2) Honeycrisp. I will be making this again for sure.

Personally, I would add less sugar. The amount of sugar likely varies between types of apples, but this was too sweet. I felt like this sauce would be better used as a filling for a pastry or pie than actual applesauce for my children. Cut the sugar in half, and it would likely be perfect for apple sauce snacking!

I made it with 10 just picked unknown variety apples,from my friends neighbor's yard. I doubled the recipe except for: water used 1 cup.
Changes I made:
Instead of Cinnamon I used Apple Pie Spice.
Instead of sugar, I used Stevia extract which is 8 to 1 as a sugar replacement. I actually used 1/2 tsp. and half a packet of 5 gs. of Sugar in the Raw.
When water is almost reduced, I added a sprinkle of cinnamon and simmered until ready to remove from heat.
Made just over 4 cups of homemade applesauce. Not overly sweet.
Would be wonderful for diabetics and dieters.
Easy but ridiculously yummy!

First timer here, I have made several appe dishes, never applesauce. Only change I did was use apple cider instead of water and threw in some redhots(maybe tablespoon). I used Jonathon & golden delicious. Doubled recipe, next time I will quadruple it. Super good!!!!!! Thanks Sarah other recipes I looked at had too many ingredients.
Great warm or cold, and great when less than fully mashed (chunky). And you can do the same with pears!

It was so good! I did have to strain the excess water out which wasn't a problem for me then i put the apples in my food processor. With the extra juice I strained I squeezed a lemon in and drank it. The apple sauce turned out good and wasn't overly sweet my little brothers give it 5 stars.
This sauce is absolutely fantastic. Since finding this recipe, I make it all the time. Perfect with pork, and lovely to eat just on its own!
Easy to make, really delicious. I left mine chunky.

I can't believe the crazy karen that gave this recipe a 2 star review even though it "tasted delicious" because of some long crazy conspiracy theorist sugar rant and all the subsequent crazy likes of the review! ?? That user was right in that this recipe tastes delicious. This recipe is perfect! Absolutely amazing! A fall family tradition in my home. Five stars for deliciousness here, not two! ?? Definitely recommend!

I used about 7 Gala apples before they went bad. It was wonderful! More is better as it goes fast. And it‚Äôs sweet enough with that ratio. I think it would be too watery and sweet. otherwise. Thanks for the recipe.
Delicious!!

Easy. I used apples from my tree, (which I don‚Äôt know what kind they are - half sour, half sweet). It was wonderful . I left it as is and tripled the recipe. 
@Jules review thought there was too much sugar, but you (Sarah) used Granny Smith, right? Those are sour . So how can that be too much . Anyway thank you for the recipe.
It was really good but a little too sweet. I will add less sugar and water next time i make it.
Great recipe just as it is...no need to tweek in any way!!!
Very easy recipe and it came out amazing! I can never go back to store bought applesauce!!

Not a bad recipe. I had extra apples and my grandma had just had some dental work making it hard for her to chew, so I made her some apple sauce! I will say though- that from making it for my daughter when she was a baby, I learned that if you steam them first And then blend and combine ingredients, you get the most nutrition from the apples! So I would personally recommend doing that instead.
Easy, delicious. Make it in quantity so that you have it on hand.
Perfect! I tossed everything in the blender after.
This is the best applesauce I have ever made. My family loves it too.

So yummy!! I‚Äôve made this fun recipe 2 times now and the first time I ate all of it in one night, (because it‚Äôs that good) and so the second time I doubled the recipe. I recommend adding slightly less water and cinnamon then called for, substitute half the white sugar for brown sugar and you definitely want to peel all the apples first and then chop them all together. Make sure to stir the mixture while it‚Äôs cooking sometimes because otherwise there is a chance it could boil over. It‚Äôs unlikely so don‚Äôt worry. Also, peeling and cutting the apples definitely took the longest, so get started on that right away! Wonderful recipe, especially since I have braces right now and it‚Äôs hard to find things to eat Thank you!!
Sickly sweet, like eating syrup. Why this is rated five stars is beyond me.

I‚Äôve been making this recipe as written for years - it comes out great every time. I have just made my first sugar-free batch, subbing Pure Cane sweetener for the sugar. It was still great. I shared this recipe with my brother who made pear sauce instead, which I plan to try also, subbing Chinese 5 spice powder for the cinnamon.

This turned out great! I had a few adjustments though for my diet. I put Splenda in instead. I also found that after cooking the apples, mashing them with a fork or masher was useless. I put it through a food processor just a little till it mashed up to the right consistency. This tasted just like store bought! Not only is this great but calorie free, although apples have calories.
It turned out great. I did put a squeeze of lemon in it to give a little acid. The family loved it.
